problem_text:
Let n ∈ N. Is it true that for any a, b, c ∈ N satisfying 1 < a, b, c ⩽ n − 2 the symmetric group Sn has elements of order a and b whose product has order c?
S. Kohl
answer: Yes, it is (G. A. Miller, Amer. J. Math., 22, no. 2 (1900), 185–190). Another solution is in (J. König, Eur. J. Comb., 57 (2016), 50–56).
